data.name: help_message
data.value: Hello, I am CJTasksHelperBot. I will help you organize your tasks and homework. Some commands are executed in several steps, so you need to keep entering the necessary information or cancel the command. Some commands support command line arguments with flags. For details, add the -h|--help flag to the command (separated by a space). This flag takes precedence over other flags, so others will be ignored. To interact with me, use the following commands: /start — show available commands /help — show this help /get_current_user — show the name of the current user /add_task — add a task /get_tasks — view tasks /ch_lang — change the display language for the chat /update_status — update task status /stop — stop the current command

data.name: HelpAddTask
data.value: Help with the /add_task command Available arguments: -t|--title — enter the title of the task --des|--description — enter a description of the task --dl|--deadline — enter the deadline of the task. The deadline must be in the format dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm or dd.MM.yyyy If one argument is specified, all others must be specified. Each argument must be followed by the corresponding value. The command can also be called without arguments, in which case the user will be prompted to enter the required values interactively. To interrupt the command in this mode, you can enter /stop

data.name: HelpGetTasks
data.value: Help with the /get_tasks command Available arguments: --dt|--drawtable — display tasks in a table form You do not need to write anything after the argument, it is just a flag. The behavior of the bot when executing a command in groups and a private conversation with the bot is different: — in a group, the bot will only show tasks from that group; — in a private conversation, a built-in keyboard will appear, which will allow you to select a group from which to show tasks, choose a display mode, and filter tasks by their status

data.name: HelpChangeLanguage
data.value: Help with the /ch_lang command ❗️Only group administrators can change the language of a group Available arguments: -l|--language — enter the language code The argument must be followed by the code of the available language. The command can also be called without arguments, in which case the user will be prompted to enter the required code interactively. To interrupt the command in this mode, you can enter /stop

data.name: HelpUpdateTaskStatus
data.value: Help with the /update_status command ❗️The command works only in a private conversation with the bot Available arguments: -i|--id — task number/id -t|--title — task name (can be partial) -s|--status — new task status (code) If one argument is specified, all others must be specified. Each argument must be followed by the corresponding value. The command can also be called without arguments, in which case the user will be prompted to enter the required values interactively. To interrupt the command in this mode, you can enter /stop
